snippet: Fighting that killed three police officers put the spotlight on the local Afghan police forces that are seen as a critical hedge against the Taliban as Western forces begin their withdrawal.
abstract: Attack by six Taliban infiltrators in the eastern province of Paktika, Afghanistan, kills three police officers but is put down before it reaches the government offices that were its target; fighting again puts the spotlight on the importance of the local Afghan police force, a US-trained group that is seen as a critical hedge against the Taliban as Western forces begin their withdrawal.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Khost Province, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Fighting that killed three police officers put the spotlight on the local Afghan police forces that are seen as a critical hedge against the Taliban as Western forces begin their withdrawal.

headline.seo: Thwarted Attack Highlights Afghan Local Police Force
headline.main: Afghan Police In Spotlight After Foiling Taliban Strike
headline.print_headline: Afghan Police In Spotlight After Foiling Taliban Strike
